comments:
Build ID: M20070103-0800


Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open each type of log file (e.g. Apache/IHS access.log/error.log).
2. Right click on Correlations and create a log correlation and name it "myCorr".
3. Right click on myCorr and select Open with > Log View.
4. Right click on a record and select Correlate by time
5. Delete the correlation. The log interaction view and log view are refreshed with new contents.
6. Repeat steps 1 to 4.
7. Delete the log used in Correlation. 

Repeating this test case after refreshing the Log View and re-importing the same logs throws the following error in the Error Log and turns the Error Log into another Tab showing the Log Interactions View (if it was open at the time the error was thrown):

More information:

If you can't reproduce it on the first try, refresh your Logs folder from the file system (removing the two log files imported) and then try the test case again. I am actually getting various null pointer exceptions when performing operations in the Log View/Log Interactions View for an extended period of time.

Created an attachment (id=57296)
Error Log

I have attached the full error log to show all the errors from this session.

I reproduced this defect on a second machine this morning. The sequence of actions to reproduce was to perform the test case once then refresh the Logs folder from the file system, re-import the logs and try to open Log Interactions.

Created an attachment (id=57383)
Log file showing nullPointers

I am attaching my log from my test suite execution yesterday. (look near the top at the Jan 22 timestamps)

I have found after doing some investigations on this defect that when you refresh from local or replace an existing log, the selection cached by the log interactions diagram is a CBE which doesn't have the agent set anymore so this case would need to be handled properly.

This defect can be easily fixed by checking on each call cbe.getAgent() if the agent is not null. Eugene, please assign this defect to me, I already have another one that deals wit a similar problem in the interactions view.
AS a workaround for avoiding the problem I believe closing the log interactions diagram would solve the errors.

Refresh from local is not a common scenario, is this happening also on delete? I wasn't able to reporduce the problem by only deleting the logs, but theoretically I can see a chance that this can happen.
